meanings.definition: The state or quality of being jolly or cheerful.
meanings.sent1: The children's faces lit up with jollity when they saw the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent2: The party was filled with jollity as everyone laughed and danced together.
meanings.sent3: The jollity in the room was contagious, spreading smiles to all the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed with jollity, brightening up the gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The jollity in the air was like a warm hug, wrapping everyone in happiness.

meanings.definition: A festive or merry gathering or celebration.
meanings.sent1: The town square was alive with jollity during the holiday festival.
meanings.sent2: The jollity of the wedding reception could be heard from blocks away.
meanings.sent3: The jollity of the birthday party reached its peak when the cake was brought out.
meanings.sent4: The jollity of the carnival filled the night with music and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The jollity of the parade made the streets come alive with joy.
